Articles.Content:
So I was on EVA on Ike's Midlands and did an EVA report, and i saw this:

> 
> You look up into the sky and see something zip past...

![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Is the Magic Boulder back, or is just a reference to the past of KSP?
That was added after Magic Boulder was already missing.

> 
> That was added after Magic Boulder was already missing.

Or was it...

Yeah, unless the thing's hard-coded into the game, it's gone. Not in any of the standard folders.

Please put it back? 

Maybe the ore-rich asteroids will have the "Magic Boulder" look.

> 
> Or was it...
> Yeah, unless the thing's hard-coded into the game, it's gone. Not in any of the standard folders.
> 
> Please put it back? 
> 
> Maybe the ore-rich asteroids will have the "Magic Boulder" look.

... and if that is true, w can just hyperedit or redirect one into Ike orbit.

It is neither fully removed from nor fully incorporated into the game right now. It's still in the software and what you're seeing is some of the leftover aspects, but you won't find the object itself while playing in the game.
